an4.197:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an4.197:1.2: Then Queen Mallikā went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
an4.197:2.1: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why in this life some females are ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:2.2: and poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant?
an4.197:3.1: And why are some females ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:3.2: but rich, affluent, wealthy, and illustrious?
an4.197:4.1: And why are some females attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty;
an4.197:4.2: but poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant?
an4.197:5.1: And why are some females attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty; and rich, affluent, wealthy, and illustrious?”
an4.197:6.1: “Take a female who is irritable and bad-tempered.
an4.197:6.2: Even when criticized a little bit she loses her temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
an4.197:6.3: She doesn’t give to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
an4.197:6.5: envying, resenting, and begrudging the possessions, honor, respect, reverence, homage, and veneration given to others.
an4.197:6.6: If she comes back to this state of existence after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:6.7: and poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant.
an4.197:7.1: Take another female who is irritable and bad-tempered. …
an4.197:7.3: But she does give to ascetics or brahmins …
an4.197:7.6: If she comes back to this state of existence after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking;
an4.197:7.7: but rich, affluent, wealthy, and illustrious.
an4.197:8.1: Take another female who isn’t irritable and bad-tempered. …
an4.197:8.3: But she doesn’t give to ascetics or brahmins …
an4.197:8.6: If she comes back to this state of existence after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty;
an4.197:8.7: but poor, with few assets and possessions; and insignificant.
an4.197:9.1: Take another female who isn’t irritable and bad-tempered. …
an4.197:9.3: She gives to ascetics and brahmins …
an4.197:9.6: If she comes back to this state of existence after passing away, wherever she is reborn she’s attractive, good-looking, lovely, of surpassing beauty;
an4.197:9.7: and rich, affluent, wealthy, and illustrious.
an4.197:10.1: This is why are some females are ugly …
an4.197:11.1: When this was said, Queen Mallikā said to the Buddha:
an4.197:11.2: “Sir, in another life I must have been irritable and bad-tempered.
an4.197:11.3: Even when lightly criticized I must have lost my temper, becoming annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, and displaying annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
an4.197:11.4: For now I am ugly, unattractive, and bad-looking.
an4.197:12.1: In another life I must have given to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting. For now I am rich, affluent, and wealthy.
an4.197:13.1: In another life, I must not have been jealous, envying, resenting, and begrudging the possessions, honor, respect, reverence, homage, and veneration given to others. For now I am illustrious.
an4.197:13.2: In this royal court I command maidens of the aristocrats, brahmins, and householders.
an4.197:13.3: So, sir, from this day forth I will not be irritable and bad-tempered.
an4.197:13.4: Even when heavily criticized I won’t lose my temper, become annoyed, hostile, and hard-hearted, or display annoyance, hate, and bitterness.
an4.197:13.5: I will give to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
an4.197:13.6: I will not be jealous, envying, resenting, and begrudging the possessions, honor, respect, reverence, homage, and veneration given to others.
an4.197:13.7: Excellent, sir! … From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
